snippet: The rescue package aims to reduce Greek's debt levels to 120.5 percent of the gross domestic product, but economists at the Royal Bank of Scotland said the ratio could end up closer to 160 percent.
abstract: The rescue package aims to reduce Greek's debt levels to 120.5 percent of the gross domestic product, but economists at the Royal Bank of Scotland said the ratio could end up closer to 160 percent.

headline.main: Assessing Debt Relief in Greek Deal
